title: Permanently Banned for no reason
body:

ok so i was kinda joking, but if we wanna be serious, then it would be a negative score. "so many negative upvotes" is the same as "so many downvotes". More downvotes than upvotes means the post would have a negative score, not a negative number of upvotes. It is 100% impossible for something to have a negative number of upvotes. You can't have a negative number of upvotes just like you can't have a negative number of apples. You can take away an upvote you have already given, but you can't take away an upvote you haven't given.

>     "negative upvotes" oh so you mean downvotes?

Nope, if i mean't downvotes I would've said something like why does this post have any downvotes. when I said negative upvotes i meant specifically that the number of downvotes is greater than the number of upvotes - it has a negative number of upvotes, or "negative upvotes". I think it's funny that the notice calls the chat logs gross and disgusting, and then they're blank.

It's because your saying nothing was creating a negative experience. If enough people report you for something, then it's the red flag that what you're doing is "against the community standards"

The community standards are established by people who report people. So if a lot of people report you for negative behavior, it's because of something you said (or didn't say) and this "ruined their experience".

So when Riot says that they don't ban people when they follow the summoners code, for not talking, for being bad, etc, it's all a lie. The ones who decides who should be punished are the small minority who report you and that's all that's taken into consideration. I've had Riot employees tell me this for months now, so dont bother asking them to take back their ban. "the people have spoken" will be their answer.
Why would i troll / being bad im 90% winrate trying my best i never gave up on the game even if we were losing

And this is a Quote from Princess Bubblegum saying that the Instant feedback system runs on the amount of times players report you for something.

With Riots behavioral team, the people who enforce and approve punishments, saying that it doesn't matter if you're following the words of other Rioters and that the Summoners code doesn't mean anything if people don't like you doing (or not doing) something, then there's really nothing you can do to stop it.

So when I say it's purely because it's because the players who're reporting you are the ones who dictate who gets punished or not, this is because these are not my words. These are Riots words.

Princess Bubblegum said the same thing as spine splitter, that reports are A factor. Becuase they are and again, not the only factor. It is just the first step in the processes.
